Intro.text:
Recommended therapy for malaria depends on species, regional resistance patterns, and disease severity. Many treatment regimens include a combination of agents
Medications listed in most recent CDC guidelines
[1]
include:
Atovaquone-proguanil
(Malarone)
Artemether-lumefantrine
Artesunate
Quinine
,
Quinidine
Chloroquine
,
Hydroxychloroquine
Primaquine
Artesunate (not currently licensed in the US)
Clindamycin
,
doxycycline
,
tetracycline
(used in combination with quinine/quinidine)
Other antimalarials:
Pyrimethamine
Dapsone
Atovaquone
Amodiaquine
Dihydroartemisinin
Piperaquine
